text: anyone watch developers on twitch or any other live stream?
is that a thing?
I’ve thought about it but unless I’m watching someone teach how to do something, it’s not super interesting to me other than to go “I feel like I’m watching someone work…. for fun”
i’ve heard it’s getting popular though
The idea was having some of us live stream how to do certain things, or from a list of topics, how to tackle them. How to debug issues like "this"
ahh
Luke asked if I could give him a decent person to check out -- I've watched some on youtube before from a live stream but was hoping someone had a go to person that does a good job
So basically… how-to video blog content but live-streamed
I explained it to luke that one dev could be solving problems, talking it out. and then a moderator helping by asking questions and interacting in chat
very much the concept
Did you guys get the AMA invite?
sounds like this would be a fun / related companion
I did :wink:
yea I got the AMA invite that does sound fun. and I do agree Nick that’d be useful
I'm expecting some of you to throw me a question I can't figure out
Machine learning in HubL… GO
I don't even have a smart ass response
I toyed around with the idea of building in complex math macro functions then was like… why am I even doing this
HAHAHAHA
Any way I can procure an AMA invite?
I’m gonna go see if I can find some of it… the code is frightening

There was a Chicagoland HubSpot Dev User group a week ago and <@U6GNQ7JBU> was presenting and as part of the signup everyone wrote up questions for him, mine was “what is it that developers do that really grinds your gears?” had no idea he’d essentially throw it back at me and point out like 4 things I’ve actually done. (create related blog post tools that have to query all the blog posts and do ridiculous server expensive stuff like that(this was before the new related blog post function and drove him to make it)) gave me a great laugh
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/ama>
I have a feeling I was a significant contributing factor to this frustration as well
I love the idea - would love to see others that are doing it well. Big question is are dev's finding it helpful (and why is this format more helpful than on-demand video).
there's definitely a level of "community" that you do not get with on-demand video.
There was a point where I managed to hold 4 of the top 10 slowest HubSpot pages in existance (not sure if I’m proud or not)
which I really like
ask <@U22PJPGK0> about it
ahaha
:arrow_up: Nick's one step ahead of me :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks for sharing!
Have 120 HubSpot CMS developers from all around the globe signed up already. It will be a fun time!

Yeah Matt said, before they had the cloudflare caching he was getting late night calls because servers were getting bogged down/killed by the rediculous scripts like the related posts and whatnot.  - Sorry Matt,  customer is always right even when it kills their website lol
Looking forward to it.  Always happy to see the HubSpot Dev community growing and advancing.

when I was chatting with a HubSpot CMS dev, they mentioned that might be cool to do in Workflows. Allow to build math micros as a workflow step to change data stored in contact properties or HubDB. That's pretty interesting... would cut down the need for middleware.
yeah, it feels like it’s grown leaps and bounds in the last 2 years

To be fair… the stuff I was doing was poorly executed… I made a 10x improvement to the algorithm and intend to keep using it even with the related posts function in place (while potentially rolling the related posts function into it as an improvement)
3 years ago it felt kinda like being a caveman with a bunch of other cavemen aways away hording their secrets to fire
But as soon as a native HubSpot function comes around with everything I need I’ll switch to that right away

i love it tho... the HubSpot product team releases something... then the developer community tries to push it to the limits... then HubSpot product has to build something new to accommodate how people are pushing it. :slightly_smiling_face: It's a good cycle and keeps everyone growing :slightly_smiling_face:
#DontStop
Yea I’m kinda in that boat with revamping related posts. One site I did it for though I will definitely not be fixing it for - rough client to work for.
Hell Ya!
I regularly reference this slack and mention that the community is full of knowledgeable devs
#CantStopWontStop lol
Someone asked about using templates from the marketplace recently and I basically said that if it didn’t come from an agency that had a presence in this community I wouldn’t use it
We're investing HEAVILY in our developers, the experience, and the community. It's much needed as for years marketers has been HubSpot's focus. Now Developers are top of the list
100% agreed.  I just want to be the best HubSpot Dev (and developer in general) I can be.  Having this community feels like a big help in that regard.
I just finalized some wicked cool CMS Developer programs we're kicking off second 1/2 of 2018. Come to the AMA and you'll get a preview of the roadmap :slightly_smiling_face:
Side note: gotta renew my certifications soon and I’m scared to with all the recent changes
it’s #free and all, but failure _feels_ shitty
we're going to build this community and ecosystem together - glad you all are a part of it :raised_hands::raised_hands::raised_hands::raised_hands::raised_hands:

<@U4RP6AGV9> I 100% echo your statement about buying templates and modules from the marketplace. Honestly I want to buy some of your guys stuff just to see if you know some HubL secrets or tricks I don’t
If I had anything out there I’d point you to it
What's the current state of the design cert <@U3PKJ8EQL> - what can Michael expect?
right now everything is too client-specific, I’ve never had the time to roll anything backwards to be more “generic” / re-usable

I have nothing submitted yet but a lot of custom modules that are basically on the verge of being good enough. 

Since DM1 we’ve been building our modules to be re-usable, and have had different ways of making em portable to different sites. It’s been a lot of learning though. and we definitely made a lot of one offs too.
:arrow_up: <@U4RP6AGV9> If we ran a "HubSpot CMS Hack-A-Thon" developer contest put a fire :fire: to build something more universal? :slightly_smiling_face:
I think it would probably incentivize me to make the effort :stuck_out_tongue:
haha
We're going to relaunch these Hack-a-Thons we did a few years back: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/cos-hack-a-thon>
shooting to run the first one sometime in Q4, after INBOUND
Our team did a couple of those hackathons. no idea though if anyone ever used our stuff - we did in a few projects, but it was impossible to tell if others used it.
I'm sure people did! - I still from dev's today how useful it was.
Once I have details on it, I'll let everyone know. :slightly_smiling_face:
I think we can flesh out the idea a little more and maybe get the community invovlement on what it would take for them to join and watch and want to participate in
NO!
Lets Go Colombia!!! :flag-co:
I almost signed up for this.. lol..
Never got my Hat from this.. lol.
I'll take a hat if they are passing out hats
Really <@U38EZFVFE>?? I know I sent it out. :disappointed: It was expensive as hell cuz it was one-of-a-kind. Really never got it?
I remember.. my year wasnt the hat only the card.
ahhhh ok. :stuck_out_tongue:
We will do some cool hats in future ones - plenty of opportunity to win more cool stuff. :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah budy
